iso_atomic_planetary.definition: Isomorphic patterns across atomic to planetary scales capture structural equivalences in material hierarchies—mappings where interactions, assemblies, and emergences preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical integrations, energy flows, and self-organizing regulations, validated via systems theory (e.g., phase-structural isomorphisms per web:0) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., atomic bonds to planetary ecosystems). Hard-to-vary invariants like topological persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm hierarchy/deny isolation/both in networks/neither in emergences); scores >0.98 based on 2025 physical abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to atomic through planetary scales plus principle; concrete from systems theory/web and material overlays (e.g., atomic bonding to planetary climates).
Validate coverage across scales (atomic → cellular → organism → social → technological → planetary); flag gaps as speculative (e.g., planetary-tech links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., turbulent flows); integrate diachronic depth (quantum atoms to 2025 geo-AI models).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

properties.universality: string (e.g., Implicational: if lower integrates, then higher emerges)

properties.principle: string (hard-to-vary invariant, e.g., Recursive assembly toward complexity)

data.description: Nested assemblies and part-whole relations mapping invariantly.

examples.universality: Implicational: if lower integrates, then higher emerges

data.description: State changes in systems; transitions map invariantly (e.g., atomic phases to planetary climates per web:3/5).

examples.structure: Atomic melts map to atmospheric shifts

data.description: Emergent order from interactions; assemblies map invariantly (e.g., molecular self-assembly to planetary formations per web:1/2).

examples.structure: Atomic clusters map to planetary atmospheres
